Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cypemycin (linaridins, natural AMPs; bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXM; XXW4; UCSS1b; Variants: Grisemycin)

Literature Information.Literature: This peptide antibiotic showed antimicrobial activity against M. luteus (MIC 0.2 ug/ml).Chemical modification: Cypemycin does not contain lanthionine bridges but exhibits some of the structural features of lantibiotics, notably 4 dehydrated threonines (dehydrobutyrines, Dhb) and a C-terminal S-[(Z)-2-aminovinyl]-d-cysteine. Cypemycin also possesses two l-allo-isoleucine residues and an N-terminal N,N-dimethylalanine, both unique amino acid modifications. Different from lantibiotics, Cys19 (not Ser) is dehydated and forms a ring structure with Cys22 (Claesen J and Bibb M 2010 PNAS 107:16297-302).Natural variant: Grisemycin, with three residues 5-7 deleted, has been found, but its antimicrobial activity against M. luteus was not detected even using concentrated supernatant (J Bacteriol. 2011 May;193(10):2510-6). APD update 9/21/2012; 4/2016; 7/2021 GW.
Literature Information.Author: Komiyama K, Otoguro K, Segawa T, Shiomi K, Yang H, Takahashi Y, Hayashi M, Otani T, Omura S.1993
Literature Information.Title: A new antibiotic, cypemycin. Taxonomy, fermentation, isolation and biological characteristics
